author: parithosh
content:
We've compiled a doc with the spec requirements to join `withdrawal-devnet-2`(launching this week) as well as the public Zhejiang testnet (ideally next week). The doc can be found here:
https://notes.ethereum.org/@parithosh/zhejiang-testnet-spec

TLDR:

CL: spec `v1.3.0-rc.0`
EL: eip-4895 @ commit `0fa80ec`
Engine API: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/blob/main/src/engine/shanghai.md @ commit `fb72652`


Open discussion points (mostly EL devs have to decide this I guess): 
- RLP hash to SSZ root for withdrawals, txs and receipts
- PR 146(add getPayloadBodies method) & PR 218(getPayloadBodiesByRangeV1) 

Tagging EL devs: <@758579010027782144> <@360491619402776577> <@341574016160497665> <@994589802538221650> <@687974325072035882>, it'd be amazing if you could provide us with branches or docker images for the devnet/testet

author: arnetheduck
content: minor nit: it's rlp hash vs ssz root, usually (helps keep them apart as well, root vs hash)

author: etan_status
content:
Well, we still need to agree on whether we _want_ to do the switch to SSZ.
The existing `newPayload` and `getPayload` APIs would only need to change, if we decide to put RLP roots into the ExecutionPayload (option C in pdf).
With the other approaches, no changes are necessary to the existing APIs.

An additional API to put just the `ExecutionPayloadHeader`, or just a sync context, may be introduced that lives on the side of `newPayload` / `getPayload` for use by light clients. These could be added later though (even post Capella upgrade) ‚Äî https://github.com/ethereum/execution-apis/pull/318 currently shows how that could look  like. But again, pending discussion on which approach will win üôÇ

author: marekm3498
content: so IMO, we shouldn't include it in upcoming devnet and tesntnet and we should continue the discussion and prototyping üôÇ

author: parithosh
content: agreed, lets keep it out of the devnet and discuss it parallely

author: g11tech
content: i would just prefer to update the roots to ssz shanghai  onwards and have a clean break than keeping old ones around

author: etan_status
content: yeah, still needs to be properly synchronized across client teams, and scheduled with the devnets

author: arnetheduck
content: +1 for ssz asap üôÇ

author: etan_status
content: if some ELs adopt the SSZ and others don't, it doesn't work haha

author: g11tech
content: true, it has to be an EIP targetted for shanghai inclusion

author: g11tech
content: from my understanding of ethereumjs, these roots are sort of standalone and doesnt really tie into any EL state structures, so modifying the way we compute them (shanghai onwards) should be good enough

author: g11tech
content: correct me if i am wrong <@758579010027782144>

author: ethdreamer
content: we are currently working on it üòÑ

author: potuz
content: As I stated in ACD, I am very much opposed to this, I am strongly opposed to any delay in withdrawals and there's no way in hell anyone will convince me that this change will not bring us back a few weeks, let alone completely shatter chances of having a full implementation by offsite time.

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: I kinda agree with not doing it in shanghai. We can still do it afterwards. We need to retain rlp and ssz in el anyway

author: potuz
content: In your case I can try to open the PR for geth, but still it will take weeks to merge it, port the spec repo testvectors to it, to start fuzzing. Other clients that don't have binary trees implemented will have to do it from scratch... even if it is simple (the implementation I posted in <#598292067260825641> is like 20 loc), testing for hashing sucks.
